$!You must tell DVLA if you have optic atrophy.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence

Fill in form V1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘V1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 253KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065620.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence##

Fill in form V1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘V1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 261KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065275.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have optic atrophy - download the correct form to let them know
title: Optic atrophy and driving
